item.title: The attributes behind Message Delivery Restrictions
item.description: Very helpfull!! I was about to block sending email… Pawe≈Ç Jarosz - Sep 1, 2010 Very helpfull!! I was about to block sending emails to disabled accounts - not mailbox but accounts - so I can easily and quick retrieve some data from inactive inboxes. The solution is to create an empty group in AD and set the “dLMemSubmitPerms” parameter to accept messages only from that empty group! Amazing and great many thanks!

item.title: The attributes behind Message Delivery Restrictions
item.description: Do you know what attributes are used to control who can and can’t send to a Distribution List in Exchange 2003 and Exchange 2007? or Does it use a DACL? Knowing such things is key if you are going to automate distribution list management through .NET programs, or MIIS/ILM/FIM, Quest ARS or any other tool that is talking to LDAP attributes. For Powershell you need a separate list since the names are different.
